channel.title: We fixed the login crash
channel.description:
After like 3 or more 2+ hour debugging sessions with myself, sinisoul, and zuppers, we finally managed to trace what exactly the problem was. Even after that, it took like 5 different attempts to finally come up with a fix that worked. It was a flaw in the services design with the source, but a few small changes made it work!
A HUGE thanks to zuppers, who came up with the solution we used in the end (and he found like 5+ bugs along the way that we fixed)!
With this bug out of the way, I feel MUCH more confident about being able to hold another alpha. Expect some news on that soon!

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:39, topic:549340”]stop being such a drama queen :S :S :S[/quote]Alright.

Locking the topic, again thanks to zuppers for fixing the bug and thanks to those that are supporting the project as we move forward. Expect the next alpha soon!

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:37, topic:549340”]Please stop. David, Silab is just voicing her opinions, there is no need to take it personal and get upset. :S[/quote]She goes out of her way to respond with something negative, go look at her post history. She just flat out made a personal attack and that’s the one I responded to personally. Other than that I am just defending the base, explaining why we’re using it.

I’d just ignore her if I could, but silab is the type of person that would then respond to all of my posts with “wont even respond to criticism, shit developer leave server” and just continue the bring the project down. However, I don’t care about her opinions on the source because she said she hasn’t even looked at it. She was just taking something I said and twisting it to start an argument. So I’m just going to flat out say that yes, we’re sticking with this base. If sinisoul finishes his side project I might consider moving my stuff over if (and only if) it’d be fast and easy to do. Not gunna argue any more about it, sticking with that is working so far.

Read full topic

Please stop. David, Silab is just voicing her opinions, there is no need to take it personal and get upset. :S

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:34, topic:549340”]The two of you are polar opposites where he will write something fresh repeatedly and you slap things together and get mad when it does not work or have to take criticism (projects rs06).[/quote]I don’t remember getting mad about project rs06? I spent 12 hours a day talking to people about bugs, getting death threats, real life prank calls, and using whatever “free” time I had after dealing with all that shit to try and do some development. I hardly did any development on that base at all once it took off, so I don’t see why would I get mad if something didn’t work. There were metric shit tons of shit that didn’t work, and it wasn’t my code. The base was trash.

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:34, topic:549340”]What you have now is a base that has problems with its fundamental designs sure you fixed this error good job but if you have an error with something like this chances are you will have other shit is out of whack as well (sini hinted to this). What he has is a mvc structure of the same “boring” content he has written at least 6 times for various rs engines. At the rate the two of you are going you are going to spin your wheels and get burned out AGAIN.[/quote]That’s not what has been said at all. I think the base is fine, it has a flaw that isn’t hard to fix. It’s written by the same people that wrote some of the “well written sources” that you suggest we use. We haven’t run into ANY issues with the core outside of that. All other bugs are from content we’ve added to it. But yes, I know how sinisoul works which is why while he is off having his little fun “new source” session I am still working on the current base (like I have been for the past year). He doesn’t slow me down, and I’ve been going for a while without burning out.

Miss Silabsoft:

Would it not be logical to take one of the functioning well written sources spending some time changing out packet opcodes and a few minor changes with packet sizes including some minor changes with map data if you choose something before the implementation of the xtea cipher and having a project that works and does not to be a fresh start?

“you arent writing your own base? WHAT THE FUCK?”
“wouldnt it be logical to use a premade base?”

Lol.

tl;dr - I’ve been using the base consistently since we started the project. This is the first issue I’ve run into with it, I still think it’s a good base and having one flaw doesn’t mean it isn’t. sinisoul does his own thing, doesn’t bother me.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:32, topic:549340”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=668244.msg4469187#msg4469187 date=1422000736]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668244.msg4469183#msg4469183 date=1421998299]

wait your telling me you guys been working on the server for months and you didn’t even write the base? WHAT THE FUCK
[/quote]Correct. I don’t see why that’s an issue. People had tried to make an official server from scratch and failed, but this one is making progress. So apparently one solution works? Didn’t you try to make one from scratch too? Sinisoul is working on a new base that we might transition to, but yea, I don’t see what’s wrong with using a prebuilt base, or why working for X months would imply we made our own.

  1. sounds like a shit base
  2. anything wrong with not writing the base? no absolutely not but you have spent how many months working on “content” and the alpha really didn’t show anything so maybe you should recruit more people.
    [/quote]Seriously, just shut up. You just have to find something to bitch about and put us down with. I don’t know if you’re upset that we’re actually making progress where you failed or if you’re just a basic bitch, but it’s really tiresome and bringing down the project. The base has its flaws. I didn’t write a base from scratch because I liked the one I saw and it was a nice foundation for me to start writing content rather than burn out doing something I don’t enjoy doing. People have been free to join the project from the start. What’s next on your list of complaints, oh great and perfect silabsoft? Fuck off.[/quote]

Guess I’m just a basic bitch, but it really does shed some light on why sinisoul wants to start a server from scratch. The two of you are polar opposites where he will write something fresh repeatedly and you slap things together and get mad when it does not work or have to take criticism (projects rs06). What you have now is a base that has problems with its fundamental designs sure you fixed this error good job but if you have an error with something like this chances are you will have other shit is out of whack as well (sini hinted to this). What he has is a mvc structure of the same “boring” content he has written at least 6 times for various rs engines. At the rate the two of you are going you are going to spin your wheels and get burned out AGAIN. Would it not be logical to take one of the functioning well written sources spending some time changing out packet opcodes and a few minor changes with packet sizes including some minor changes with map data if you choose something before the implementation of the xtea cipher and having a project that works and does not to be a fresh start?

Read full topic

Sinisoul is working on a new base that we might transition to, but yea, I don’t see what’s wrong with using a prebuilt base, or why working for X months would imply we made our own.

You just have to find something to bitch about and put us down with. I don’t know if you’re upset that we’re actually making progress where you failed or if you’re just a basic bitch, but it’s really tiresome and bringing down the project. The base has its flaws. I didn’t write a base from scratch because I liked the one I saw and it was a nice foundation for me to start writing content rather than burn out doing something I don’t enjoy doing. People have been free to join the project from the start. What’s next on your list of complaints, oh great and perfect silabsoft? Fuck off.

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:28, topic:549340”]wait your telling me you guys been working on the server for months and you didn’t even write the base? WHAT THE FUCK[/quote]Correct. I don’t see why that’s an issue. People had tried to make an official server from scratch and failed, but this one is making progress. So apparently one solution works? Didn’t you try to make one from scratch too? Sinisoul is working on a new base that we might transition to, but yea, I don’t see what’s wrong with using a prebuilt base, or why working for X months would imply we made our own.

[quote=“Lothy, post:29, topic:549340”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668244.msg4469179#msg4469179 date=1421997124]

It might be netty specific then. I swear youre going to run into problems with threading.

neat idea except that I know of atleast 5 servers using netty.
[/quote]It’s not that netty is the problem, it’s the way this server is using netty. I just know it’s not the threading issue sini mentioned because we tested that.

To be frank, you probably didn’t. Concurrency bugs are notoriously tricky to reproduce. Sinisoul is probably right that a race condition came into play.
And how do you know it was properly synchronized anyway? Does each client connection have a global lock or something?[/quote]I don’t know how it could be what he said when we had it write out every packet sent and blocked the packet if it wasn’t the region one. And it isn’t properly synchronized, we know that, but I’m talking specifically about this one bug which we fixed by simply adding a channel future listener.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:27, topic:549340”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=668244.msg4469176#msg4469176 date=1421994046]

It might be netty specific then. I swear youre going to run into problems with threading.

neat idea except that I know of atleast 5 servers using netty.
[/quote]It’s not that netty is the problem, it’s the way this server is using netty. I just know it’s not the threading issue sini mentioned because we tested that.[/quote]
To be frank, you probably didn’t. Concurrency bugs are notoriously tricky to reproduce. Sinisoul is probably right that a race condition came into play.
And how do you know it was properly synchronized anyway? Does each client connection have a global lock or something?

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:23, topic:549340”]I don’t see what else it could be. It was an inconsistent bug which smells of race condition. It’s possible messages were written at the same time on different threads and Netty doesn’t have thread safety embedded in the channel#write method.[/quote]Uh huh, and before that you were convinced it was just a math problem in the encoder. Which by the way, you fucked up and I had to revert to an older version XD

zuppers and I had it print out EVERY channel#write operation and the problem persisted even if nothing else was being written from the other threads.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I don’t see what else it could be. It was an inconsistent bug which smells of race condition. (There was probably a 50 MS window in updating this could happen with a frequency of 500 ms every 6 seconds which means that it had about a 1/12 chance…ish) It’s possible messages were written at the same time on different threads and Netty doesn’t have thread safety embedded in the channel#write method.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:21, topic:549340”][quote author=Lin link=topic=668244.msg4469150#msg4469150 date=1421985032]
Why was it so hard to come up with a solution? Sounds like literally all you had to do was write the region load packet right after the response code, using the same output stream. No unnecessary checks or slowdowns this way, and the server would be free to do other stuff with the player without worrying about packet order.
[/quote]

World player list isn’t synchronized between two threads. Design issue. Results in this.[/quote]You have no proof that that was the cause of this, and I’m even more inclined to doubt that is related because you tried to synchronize it and it had no effect. We fixed the issue without doing anything related to the world player list or other thread services at all. Not that it isn’t a design flaw, we had to fix another bug already because of that other issue.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Lin:

Why was it so hard to come up with a solution? Sounds like literally all you had to do was write the region load packet right after the response code, using the same output stream. No unnecessary checks or slowdowns this way, and the server would be free to do other stuff with the player without worrying about packet order.

World player list isn’t synchronized between two threads. Design issue. Results in this.

Read full topic

item.title: We fixed the login crash
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:19, topic:549340”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668244.msg4469155#msg4469155 date=1421985940]

Why was it so hard to come up with a solution? Sounds like literally all you had to do was write the region load packet right after the response code, using the same output stream. No unnecessary checks or slowdowns this way, and the server would be free to do other stuff with the player without worrying about packet order.
[/quote]I literally copied and pasted the region message encoder code right under the other login information, didn’t work. Something finnicky about netty.

did you flush inbetween?[/quote]Yup, we tried a bunch of combinations of flushing and using synchronized locks and all sorts of shit to prevent other packets from being sent.

Read full topic
